alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Clay; Foard; Hardeman; Knox; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 02 at 6:26PM CST until February 04 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Combined snow and sleet accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, with higher amounts of 5 to 7 inches possible from portions of western north Texas through central Oklahoma. Ice accumulations of one tenth of an inch or less, with higher amounts up to one half inch across southeastern Oklahoma. Very cold wind chills expected of 5 to 15 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Oklahoma and western north Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Significant travel problems expected. A few power outages are expected, especially across southeastern Oklahoma. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia in a short amount of time if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Oklahoma, call 8 4 4 4 6 5 4 9 9 7 for road information. In Texas, call 8 0 0 4 5 2 9 2 9 2 for road information.
